Articles.Content:
Hello all, I'm making a rover in career mode (idk if that makes a diff), but when I go to use it the wheels just sink into the terrain and just spin. It's as if they aren't there. When I put an engine on the back of the rover and fire it up, I can see the craft is resting on the supports and the wheels are just dragging, if I go fast enough they break off. This even happens when I attach wheels to a fuel tank.

Am I missing something?

Edited December 16, 2013 by Fett2oo5

Pics would help.

Wheels don't really work right unless they're "right side up" so if they are at an angle maybe that's the problem.

=Smidge=

Here are two pics of a rover that this happens to.

I've also designed this in the VAB, as well as a much much simpler rover.

Your wheels are sideways.

try rotating them until they work.

Oh I see it, boy do I feel dumb.

Thank you.

Oh I see it, boy do I feel dumb.

Thank you.

It's a common error with those wheels especially, the wide tab should be at the top, with the narrow tab at the bottom.

Yep, that'll do it. +1 for the Aperture Science flag!

=Smidge=

Yep, that'll do it. +1 for the Aperture Science flag!

=Smidge=

We do what we must because when can. For the good of all of us (Except the ones who are dead).
